items.title: Corporate Tax Filing: Schedule M-3: Part III

visible_instructors.name: Illumeo
visible_instructors.title: Illumeo Learning
visible_instructors.job_title: Condensed and Efficient Courses for Busy Professionals

items.headline: This course covers the Schedule M-3, Part III filing and reporting requirements.
objectives_summary: Recognize the four column reporting format for reconciling book income to taxable income.
Discover how to report common book-tax expense/deduction differences.
Identify how to report other expense/deduction items with differences on line 37.

items.title: International Tax - Royalty and Fee for Technical Services

visible_instructors.name: Arinjay Kumar
visible_instructors.title: Arinjay Kumar Jain
visible_instructors.job_title: International Tax Expert and Former Director at KPMG India

items.headline: Learn how to interpret Article 12 - Royalty and Fee for Technical Services, Right of Source and Residence State to tax
objectives_summary: Understand which payments amount to Royalty and Fee for Technical Services
Identify the Rights of Source State (India) and State of Residence to tax Royalty and Fee for Technical Services
Apply steps to be followed to ascertain Tax implications on Royalty and Fee for Technical Services and ascertaining withholding tax rates in Source State (India)

items.title: EIN Application for Non-U.S. Owner of U.S. LLC
items.headline: Every U.S. entity must apply for an EIN after entity formation - this guide will show you how
objectives_summary: A non-U.S. entrepreneur will learn how to apply for an EIN for their new business entity
We will cover all of the methods available to apply for an EIN with the IRS

items.title: GOODS AND SERVICES TAX (GST)- Intro, Levy, ITC, Reg., Return
items.headline: Understanding GST through Q & A making it "Good and Simple Tax"
objectives_summary: GST- background; basic understanding of :- chargeability, levy, availment of ITC and manner and order of its utilization, registration requirements and parameters & main returns/ forms to be filed

items.title: IRS Form 2553 "S" Corporation Election
items.headline: Learn everything you need to know about filing Form 2553 including late election relief
objectives_summary: What are the benefits and drawbacks of an "S" Corporation structure?
How to file the S corporation election?
If I file the election late, what are my options under the late election relief procedures?

items.title: A Review of Five 2020 Tax Credits
items.headline: Learn about the most common tax credits.
objectives_summary: Students will learn which tax credits they can claim, what the requirements are, and how to go about claiming the credits.

items.headline: The course addresses the fundamental US Tax issues that face US corporations investing in/managing non-US-based activity
objectives_summary: Recognize the general "Outbound" framework to allow for better communication between the operations and finance/tax sides of the business.
Identify the material, practical impact of the U.S. Outbound rules.
Identify tax topics that will help make a more profound impact on your company's investments.

items.title: Sale of Principal Residence - Avoid U.S. Capital Gains Taxes
items.headline: If you Sold Your Personal Home for a Gain, You Might Be Able to Avoid Capital Gains Taxes!!
objectives_summary: How do U.S. taxes work on the sale of your home?
How can you exclude the capital gains taxes on the sale of your home?
